title: How to record games?
body: What is the best way to record your league games? I am wanting to record my games and look back at them to see what i was doing wrong. any suggestions?

replies.body:
If you're a youtuber wanting to yell, go with Fraps. It captures your exact screen and optionally your camera and mic too

If you're a player wanting to improve from every game, go with LSI, it records your matches in spectator form and gives you statistics and your average ability.

If you're a player that wants to show the world that you're the play maker, go with replay.gg. It records your matches and sends them to your email so you can easily share them online.

I use FRAPS.
It costs about 47$
But its really worth it, it records in 1080 P HD.
Each game will be over 30 Gigs, so make sure you have space.
If you have Adobe after effects or some other rendering program. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q2iIVOGyTt4&list=PLZRrmLBrBbXFzVyMqsgy_Rtg3BvhwxpFW

follow that/them and it should tell you in about 3 mins on how to use it.
Take your Raw League footage, render it out. (I like to do 4-6 passes)
Make sure that it worked (Watch the rendered footage)
and delete the Raw footage.

Bam- you have your 20+ min game full HD 4-6 Megs.
I use op.gg . Just click ingame info and press record ez pz.

LSI - http://www.leaguelsi.com/

Just open it and leave it open. It automatically records the games you play.
It also has other features but I don't really use them

Can be a bit buggy sometimes but hey its free

If you want free screen capture software. Stuff like [oCam](http://download.cnet.com/oCam/3000-13633_4-75758209.html) or [OBS](https://obsproject.com/) works well.

there are a few  ways if you have a NVidia GeForce there is a program in it called shadow play or look in to a legato game capture card just go in to a game shop and ask for one should be about 100to 200 dolers
